results.title: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.credit_line: Courtesy Rex Guthrie / PY Media / Ara Irititja Archive
results.brief_description:
EVTV live broadcast to Ernabella (Pukatja) community, 1985

Pantjiti McKenzie OAM presents a live broadcast during the launch of “Ernabella Video Television” (EVTV) to Pukatja community (Ernabella) in the Pitjantjatjara Lands of South Australia.

results.title: "War Pictures": Australians at the Cinema 1914-1918
results.brief_description:
A compilation of archival films that chronicles the Australian cinema-going experience during WWI from 1914 to 1918.

Between 1914 and 1918, cinema attendance was on the rise and the local film industry was expanding with over 50 Australian feature films produced during the period. While many of these films have been tragically lost, those that remain offer a rare glimpse into Australian life during this turbulent time.

As the war began, filmmakers rushed to make features about Australia’s involvement. Alfred Rolfe’s ‘Hero of the Dardanelles’ (1915) told the story of Gallipoli, complete with landing scenes shot at Tamarama Beach in Sydney.

However, as the years progressed, war-weary audiences lost their taste for patriotic stories, and a new genre of home-grown comedies emerged featuring knockabout characters from the Australian bush. Throughout the war years, Hollywood dramas, serials, love stories and comedies were also staple attractions, and Charlie Chaplin was an international superstar.

War Pictures offers a wide-ranging selection of local and international material, including a focus on Australia’s ‘lost films’.

Specially commissioned introductions and musical accompaniment offer contemporary audiences a chance to step back time and experience cinema as it was enjoyed during the First World War.

This work was shown at ACMI from 10 March to 26 July 2015 in the ‘War Pictures’ exhibition.

results.title: Yoram Gross : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.
results.description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.

results.title: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with screenwriters Sue Smith and John Alsop for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Sue Smith and John Alsop are screenwriters and playwrights who have collaborated on productions such as “My Brother Jack”, “Brides of Christ”, “Bordertown” and “The Leaving of Liverpool”.

results.title: Rolf de Heer: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with director Rolf de Heer for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Rolf de Heer is a film director whose credits include “Ten Canoes”, “Charlie’s Country” and “The Tracker”.

results.title: Krome Studios: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with Krome Studios for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Krome Studios is a video game development studio most well known for their “Ty the Tasmanian Tiger” games.

results.title: Jill Bilcock: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with film editor Jill Bilcock for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Jill Bilcock is an editor known for her work on “Strictly Ballroom”, “Romeo + Juliet” and “Elizabeth”.

results.title: Chris Masters: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with journalist Chris Masters created for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Chris Masters is an investigative journalist who has won several Gold Walkley awards and reported for the ABC’s “Four Corners”.

results.title: Chris Doyle: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with cinematographer Chris Doyle for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Chris Doyle is a cinematographer well known for his work on films directed by Wong Kar Wai, including “Chungking Express”, “In the Mood for Love” and “Happy Together”.
